title: EUR/GBP Analysis: Critical Upside Risks Intensify Amid UK Political Turmoil – ING Warns
body: BitcoinWorld EUR/GBP Analysis: Critical Upside Risks Intensify Amid UK Political Turmoil – ING Warns LONDON, January 2025 – The EUR/GBP currency pair faces mounting upward pressure as political uncertainty in the United Kingdom creates volatility in forex markets. According to recent analysis from ING, Europe’s leading financial institution, the cross could test significant resistance levels in coming weeks. This development follows months of political instability that has weakened sterling’s fundamental support. Market participants now closely monitor parliamentary developments and economic indicators. Consequently, traders adjust their positions ahead of potential policy shifts. EUR/GBP Technical and Fundamental Analysis ING’s foreign exchange strategists identify several factors driving EUR/GBP movements. The pair currently trades around 0.8600, representing a key psychological level. Technical analysis reveals immediate resistance at 0.8650, with further barriers at 0.8700. Meanwhile, support holds near 0.8550. Fundamentally, political developments outweigh economic data in current market pricing. The Bank of England maintains a cautious stance amid uncertainty. Similarly, the European Central Bank monitors inflation trends carefully. Therefore, policy divergence creates additional cross-rate volatility. Recent trading sessions show increased volatility spikes during UK parliamentary debates. Market sentiment clearly reacts to political headlines. For instance, last week’s government proposal triggered a 50-pip movement within minutes. Historical data indicates similar patterns during previous political crises. The 2022 mini-budget episode caused sterling to plummet dramatically. Current conditions suggest comparable sensitivity to fiscal announcements. Consequently, risk management becomes paramount for currency traders. Comparative Currency Performance Table Currency Pair Year-to-Date Change Political Sensitivity Score Key Resistance Level EUR/GBP +2.3% High 0.8700 GBP/USD -1.8% Very High 1.2800 EUR/USD +0.9% Medium 1.0950 UK Political Landscape and Market Impact The United Kingdom enters a period of significant political transition. Multiple factors contribute to current uncertainty. First, parliamentary divisions complicate legislative processes. Second, upcoming by-elections threaten government majority. Third, policy disagreements within ruling parties create implementation risks. These elements collectively undermine economic confidence. Foreign investors particularly express concern about regulatory consistency. Additionally, trade negotiations with the European Union face renewed scrutiny. Historical analysis reveals political uncertainty typically weakens sterling. The Brexit referendum period demonstrated this relationship clearly. Between June 2016 and October 2016, GBP depreciated approximately 18% against major currencies. Current conditions show similar characteristics, though with different catalysts. Market participants now price political risk premiums into sterling assets. Government bond yields reflect these concerns through widening spreads. Meanwhile, equity markets show sector-specific vulnerabilities. Key political developments to monitor include: Parliamentary votes on economic legislation Leadership positions within major parties Policy announcements affecting business regulation International relations with trading partners Fiscal policy direction and implementation ING’s Analytical Framework and Forecast Methodology ING employs a comprehensive approach to currency analysis. Their methodology combines quantitative models with qualitative assessment. First, econometric models process historical data and correlations. Second, political risk analysis evaluates institutional stability. Third, market positioning data reveals sentiment extremes. Fourth, technical analysis identifies key chart levels. This multi-faceted approach provides robust forecasting capabilities. The institution’s research department maintains extensive databases. These include decades of political event correlations with currency movements. Analysts particularly study regime change periods and their market impacts. Furthermore, they monitor capital flows across asset classes. Recent reports highlight foreign direct investment trends. European investors show reduced UK exposure since political uncertainty intensified. Japanese and American investors follow similar patterns, though with different timing. Expert Insight: Political Risk Assessment Financial institutions increasingly incorporate political science methodologies. ING collaborates with academic institutions specializing in political risk. Their joint research identifies specific triggers for currency movements. Parliamentary confidence votes historically cause immediate volatility. Similarly, cabinet reshuffles affect medium-term trends. Policy U-turns create the most sustained impacts, particularly regarding fiscal matters. The current situation presents unique characteristics. Unlike the Brexit period, the European Union relationship remains stable. However, domestic policy uncertainty reaches comparable levels. Market participants struggle to price this unfamiliar combination. Consequently, volatility persists across timeframes. Options markets reflect this through elevated implied volatility measures. Risk reversals show pronounced skew toward sterling weakness. Market Structure and Participant Behavior Forex market participation has evolved significantly in recent years. Algorithmic trading now dominates short-term price action. These systems react to news headlines within milliseconds. Political developments therefore create immediate, sometimes exaggerated, movements. Human traders focus on longer timeframes, assessing fundamental developments. This dichotomy creates interesting market dynamics during political events. Institutional positioning data reveals interesting patterns. Hedge funds maintain net short sterling positions against the euro. Asset managers show more balanced exposure, though with reduced overall UK allocation. Corporate hedgers increase their activity, particularly among exporters. Central bank activity remains limited, though monitoring intensifies. Market liquidity shows typical patterns, with concentration during European trading hours. Key market structure considerations include: Liquidity conditions during political announcements Positioning extremes and contrarian signals Correlation breakdowns between typically related assets Volatility transmission across currency pairs Option market pricing of tail risks Economic Fundamentals and Policy Implications Beyond political developments, economic fundamentals influence EUR/GBP. The United Kingdom faces specific challenges. Inflation remains above target despite monetary tightening. Growth forecasts continue to deteriorate amid uncertainty. Productivity measures show concerning stagnation. Meanwhile, the eurozone demonstrates relative stability. Inflation convergence toward target levels progresses steadily. Growth, while modest, shows consistent positive trends. Monetary policy divergence presents additional cross-rate influences. The Bank of England maintains restrictive policy, though communication turns more cautious. The European Central Bank follows a similar path, but with different timing. This creates interesting rate differential dynamics. Historically, widening rate differentials support the higher-yielding currency. However, political risk currently overwhelms this relationship. Market participants prioritize stability over yield in current conditions. Fiscal policy represents another crucial consideration. The UK government faces difficult choices regarding taxation and spending. Market scrutiny of public finances intensifies daily. Credit rating agencies monitor developments closely. Any perceived deterioration in fiscal sustainability would pressure sterling further. European fiscal frameworks provide more stability, though not without challenges. Historical Context and Comparative Analysis Political uncertainty affecting currencies is not unprecedented. Historical analysis provides valuable perspective. The 1992 Exchange Rate Mechanism crisis shares some characteristics. Political divisions regarding European integration created sterling pressure. However, current circumstances differ significantly in global context. The 2008 financial crisis period shows different patterns, with systemic risk dominating. More recent episodes offer closer parallels. The 2014 Scottish independence referendum created similar uncertainty. Sterling volatility increased substantially during that period. The 2016 Brexit referendum represents the most extreme modern example. Current conditions show some similarities, though with different underlying causes. Comparative analysis helps identify potential scenarios and their probabilities. Risk Management Considerations for Market Participants Currency volatility requires careful risk management. Market participants employ various strategies. Hedging programs adjust to increased uncertainty. Option strategies gain popularity for their asymmetric payoff profiles. Position sizing becomes more conservative during volatile periods. Correlation assumptions undergo frequent reassessment. Institutional investors particularly focus on portfolio-level impacts. Currency movements affect international asset returns significantly. Pension funds and insurance companies adjust their hedging ratios. Corporate treasurers face challenging decisions regarding transactional exposures. Small and medium enterprises increasingly utilize currency risk management tools previously reserved for larger corporations. Conclusion The EUR/GBP currency pair faces significant upside risks amid UK political uncertainty. ING’s analysis highlights the complex interplay between political developments and currency markets. Technical levels suggest potential resistance around 0.8700, while fundamental factors support further euro strength. Market participants must monitor political developments closely while maintaining robust risk management frameworks. Historical parallels provide context, though each period presents unique characteristics. Ultimately, political resolution will determine medium-term direction for the EUR/GBP cross rate. FAQs Q1: What does EUR/GBP upside risk mean for traders? Upside risk indicates greater probability of the euro strengthening against the British pound. Traders might consider long EUR/GBP positions or hedging strategies against sterling weakness. Q2: How does UK political uncertainty specifically affect currency markets? Political uncertainty creates policy unpredictability, reducing investor confidence in sterling assets. This typically leads to capital outflows and currency depreciation as markets price increased risk premiums. Q3: What time horizon does ING’s analysis typically cover? ING provides analysis across multiple timeframes. Short-term forecasts cover weeks to months, while medium-term analysis extends to quarters. Their political risk assessment particularly focuses on the 3-6 month horizon. Q4: Are there historical precedents for current EUR/GBP movements? Yes, several historical periods show similarities. The 2016 Brexit referendum period and 1992 ERM crisis both featured political uncertainty driving currency volatility, though with different underlying causes and global contexts. Q5: What other currency pairs show sensitivity to UK political developments? GBP/USD typically shows the highest sensitivity, followed by GBP/JPY and GBP/CHF. EUR/GBP represents the most direct eurozone exposure to UK political risk, making it particularly important for European investors. This post EUR/GBP Analysis: Critical Upside Risks Intensify Amid UK Political Turmoil – ING Warns first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: EUR/USD Stalls at Critical One-Week Highs as Markets Hold Breath for Pivotal US Retail Sales
body: BitcoinWorld EUR/USD Stalls at Critical One-Week Highs as Markets Hold Breath for Pivotal US Retail Sales LONDON, March 12, 2025 – The EUR/USD currency pair, the world’s most traded forex instrument, has entered a pronounced consolidation phase. After a steady climb, the pair now stalls decisively at one-week highs. Market participants globally are pivoting their attention toward the imminent release of US Retail Sales data, a key economic indicator with a proven history of triggering significant volatility. This pause reflects a classic market behavior: a collective hesitation before a potential catalyst that could redefine short-term directional bias. EUR/USD Technical Analysis: Deciphering the Stall Technical charts provide the clearest visual evidence of the current stall. The pair’s recent ascent met firm resistance near the 1.0950 level, a zone that previously acted as both support and resistance. Consequently, this area now functions as a technical battleground. On the four-hour chart, the price action shows a series of smaller candlesticks with overlapping ranges. This pattern indicates a clear loss of bullish momentum and a balance between buying and selling pressure. Key technical levels frame this consolidation. The immediate resistance sits at the weekly high of 1.0965. Meanwhile, initial support rests at the 1.0900 psychological handle, followed by the 1.0870 level, which aligns with the 50-period moving average. The Relative Strength Index (RSI), a momentum oscillator, has retreated from overbought territory above 70 to a more neutral reading near 55. This retreat suggests the prior buying frenzy has subsided, allowing the market to await fresh fundamental input. Market Mechanics Behind the Pause Several mechanical factors explain this stalling price action. First, short-term speculative traders are actively booking profits following the pair’s recent gains. Second, institutional desks are reducing their exposure and hedging existing positions ahead of the high-impact data release. This risk-management activity naturally suppresses volume and limits large directional bets. Finally, algorithmic trading systems, which dominate forex liquidity, often enter a more reactive mode before major events, contributing to the tight, range-bound trading. The US Retail Sales Catalyst: Why This Data Matters The US Retail Sales report, published monthly by the Census Bureau, serves as a primary gauge of consumer spending strength. Consumer expenditure drives approximately two-thirds of the US economy, making this release a critical barometer of economic health. For forex markets, the data directly influences expectations for Federal Reserve monetary policy. Stronger-than-expected sales can fuel inflation concerns, bolstering the case for a more hawkish Fed stance, which typically strengthens the US Dollar (USD). Conversely, weak data may signal economic softening, potentially weakening the USD. The consensus forecast for the upcoming release, according to a Bloomberg survey of economists, points to a month-over-month increase of 0.4% for the headline figure. The core reading, which excludes volatile automotive and gasoline sales, is anticipated to rise by 0.3%. The market’s reaction, however, will hinge on the deviation from these expectations. Historical volatility studies show that deviations exceeding 0.3 percentage points have a 75% probability of causing a EUR/USD move of 40 pips or more within the first hour of release. Comparative Impact of Recent US Data Data Release (Recent) Actual vs. Forecast Immediate EUR/USD Reaction Non-Farm Payrolls (Feb) Stronger -55 pips (USD strengthened) CPI Inflation (Jan) In-line +18 pips (limited move) ISM Services PMI Weaker +42 pips (USD weakened) Broader Economic Context and Diverging Policies This stall occurs within a complex macroeconomic backdrop. The European Central Bank (ECB) and the Federal Reserve remain on divergent policy paths, though the gap is narrowing. The ECB has recently signaled a cautious approach toward further rate cuts, citing persistent services inflation within the Eurozone. Meanwhile, the Fed has paused its hiking cycle but maintains a data-dependent posture. This policy divergence is a fundamental driver for the EUR/USD pair, and the Retail Sales data will feed directly into the Fed’s calculus. Geopolitical factors also linger in the background. Stability in European energy markets and ongoing fiscal debates in the US Congress about debt ceilings add layers of uncertainty. However, for today’s session, these broader narratives have taken a secondary role to the immediate, quantifiable risk posed by the US economic data. Traders are effectively discounting all other noise until the number is released. Expert Insight on Market Positioning Senior analysts from major investment banks note a shift in market positioning. “Commitments of Traders (COT) data indicates that speculative net-long positions on the Euro have increased for three consecutive weeks,” explains a markets strategist from a top-tier European bank, referencing publicly available CFTC data. “This creates a crowded trade scenario. A strong USD-positive Retail Sales figure could trigger a sharp unwinding of these positions, leading to a rapid downside move. The current stall is the calm before that potential storm.” This analysis underscores the fragility of the current price level and the binary nature of the impending risk. Potential Scenarios and Price Paths Post-Release Market technicians outline two primary scenarios based on the data outcome. A bullish scenario for the USD (weak EUR/USD) would require a Retail Sales print significantly above consensus, say 0.7% or higher. This outcome would likely break the pair below the 1.0870 support, targeting 1.0820. Conversely, a bearish scenario for the USD (strong EUR/USD) would be triggered by a flat or negative print, potentially propelling the pair above the 1.0965 resistance toward the 1.1000 psychological barrier. Scenario 1: Strong Data (>0.6%): Break below 1.0870. Target: 1.0820. USD strengthens on heightened Fed hawkishness. Scenario 2: In-Line Data (0.3%-0.5%): Continued choppy consolidation between 1.0900 and 1.0965. “Buy the rumor, sell the news” volatility may fade quickly. Scenario 3: Weak Data ( Break above 1.0965 resistance. Target: 1.1000-1.1020. USD weakens on softened Fed expectations. Risk management, therefore, becomes paramount. Experienced traders often reduce position sizes or employ options strategies to hedge against the increased volatility, rather than attempting to predict the outcome. Conclusion The EUR/USD stall at one-week highs represents a textbook example of market anticipation. Technical indicators show exhausted momentum, while the fundamental landscape hinges entirely on the upcoming US Retail Sales release. This data point will provide critical evidence on the resilience of the US consumer and, by extension, influence the Federal Reserve’s policy trajectory. The resulting move will likely determine whether the pair resumes its upward trend or reverses into a deeper correction. For traders and analysts, this pause is not an absence of activity but a period of concentrated focus, where disciplined risk management and a clear understanding of economic mechanics are essential. The EUR/USD path forward will be dictated by the hard numbers in this pivotal report. FAQs Q1: Why is US Retail Sales data so important for the EUR/USD pair? The US Retail Sales report is a primary indicator of consumer spending and economic strength in the United States. Since consumer spending drives a majority of US GDP, strong data can lead to expectations of tighter monetary policy (higher interest rates) from the Federal Reserve, which typically strengthens the US Dollar against the Euro, and vice versa. Q2: What does it mean when a currency pair “stalls” or consolidates? Stalling or consolidation refers to a period where the price trades within a relatively narrow range without a clear directional trend. This often occurs after a significant move or ahead of a major news event, as buyers and sellers reach an equilibrium and await new information to decide the next direction. Q3: What technical levels are traders watching for EUR/USD right now? Traders are closely watching the immediate resistance at the one-week high near 1.0965 and support at the psychological level of 1.0900, followed by the more substantial 1.0870 level. A break above or below this range will signal the next directional move. Q4: How quickly does the market react to the Retail Sales data? The market reaction is typically immediate and occurs within the first few minutes of the data release at 8:30 AM Eastern Time. The most volatile period usually lasts for 15-60 minutes as liquidity adjusts and orders are filled. Q5: Besides Retail Sales, what other factors influence EUR/USD? Other major factors include monetary policy decisions and statements from the ECB and Fed, inflation data (CPI) from both regions, geopolitical events, relative economic growth rates, and broader risk sentiment in global financial markets. This post EUR/USD Stalls at Critical One-Week Highs as Markets Hold Breath for Pivotal US Retail Sales first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Leading AI Claude Predicts the Price of XRP, Cardano and Ethereum By the End of 2026
body: Feeding Claude AI carefully structured prompts unlocks explosive price projections for XRP, Cardano, and Ethereum in 2026. According to Claude, all three could hit fresh ATHs over the next eleven months. Below we examine whether Claude’s claims are justified by technical signals and the news cycle. XRP ($XRP): Claude Maps a Long-Term Route Toward $8 by 2027 In a recent blog post , Ripple confirmed XRP ($XRP) remains central to its vision to make the XRPLedger an institutional-grade payments infrastructure. Source: Claude Already known for lightning fast settlement and negligible costs, XRPL also offers what could be the two biggest use cases in crypto: stablecoins and real world asset tokenization. Currently trading near $1.43, Claude predicts XRP could climb to $8 by the end of 2026, a nearly 6x increase. From a technical standpoint, XRP’s Relative Strength Index (RSI) is uptrending from 31, indicating that investors are buying back in after a period of heavy selling rocked the entire market. Institutional inflows through newly approved U.S.-based XRP exchange-traded funds, combined with Ripple’s expanding partner network and the potential passage of the U.S. CLARITY bill this year, could even propel XRP beyond Claude’s bull case. Cardano (ADA): Claude Projects a Potential 1,100% Upside Created by Ethereum co-founder Charles Hoskinson, Cardano ($ADA) leverages peer-reviewed development, security, scalability, and sustainability. With a market cap around $10 billion and more than $127 million in TVL Cardano’s growing ecosystem supports its long-term growth. Claude says ADA could rise over 1,100%, from its current price of $0.26 to $3.25 by Christmas, pushing it comfortably above its 2021 ATH: $3.09. That said, ADA is currently trading at its lowest level since October 2024. Given the year’s unpredictability so far, another downturn could see ADA slipping the $0.20 to $0.25 support level. Ethereum ($ETH): Claude Identifies a Possible 5x Setup Ethereum ($ETH) , the world’s leading smart contract platform, underpins most of the DeFi/Web3 infrastructure. With a market capitalization of around $243 billion and more than $56 billion locked across DeFi protocols, Ethereum remains the primary settlement layer for blockchain commerce. Its proven security, dominant position in stablecoins, and early leadership in real-world asset tokenization position Ethereum well to capture increased institutional demand. However, substantial inflows depend on whether U.S. lawmakers approve the CLARITY bill, which will provide the regulatory certainty institutions need to deploy capital on the network, either through stablecoins or tokenized real-world assets. ETH trades around $2,000, with heavy resistance expected near the $5,000 level after reaching an ATH of $4,946.05 last August. If Claude’s bullish outlook materializes, a clean breakout above $5,000 could pave the way for multiple new ATHs in 2026, with Claude capping ETH’s growth at a heady $7,500 in a full-scale bull market. Maxi Doge: Roll Over, Dogecoin! Maxi’s The New Alpha of Memesville! Finally, while Claude sees XRP, Cardano and Ethereum as relatively safe bets, investors chasing old school crypto upside will want to allocate a small portion of their portfolio to new high-volatility meme coins. Maxi Doge ($MAXI) is one of the most discussed meme coin presales of 2026 so far, raising $4.6 million before launch. The project’s mascot is an louche, high-energy parody (and distant cousin) of Dogecoin, blending gym-bro intensity with degen humor to revive the irreverent meme culture that shot Dogecoin and Shiba Inu to stardom. MAXI is an ERC-20 token on Ethereum’s proof-of-stake network, giving it a smaller environmental footprint compared to Dogecoin’s proof-of-work model. Presale participants can currently stake MAXI tokens to earn yields of up to 68% APY, with rewards decreasing over time as the staking pool grows. The token is $0.0002803 in the current presale stage, with automatic price increases triggered at each funding milestone. Purchases are supported via MetaMask and Best Wallet . title: USD/JPY Plummets: Critical 155.00 Level in Sight as Traders Brace for US Retail Sales Data
body: BitcoinWorld USD/JPY Plummets: Critical 155.00 Level in Sight as Traders Brace for US Retail Sales Data In Asian trading sessions on Tuesday, May 13, 2025, the USD/JPY currency pair extended its recent decline, edging perilously close to the psychologically significant 155.00 level. This downward pressure arrives as global forex markets adopt a cautious stance ahead of the highly anticipated U.S. Retail Sales report for April, scheduled for release later today. Consequently, traders are closely monitoring this key economic indicator for fresh signals on the Federal Reserve’s monetary policy path and potential intervention thresholds from the Bank of Japan. USD/JPY Technical Breakdown and Market Sentiment The USD/JPY pair’s movement represents a critical juncture in forex markets. After reaching multi-decade highs above 160.00 in late 2024, the pair has entered a corrective phase. Market analysts attribute this pullback to several concurrent factors. First, a modest recalibration of Federal Reserve interest rate expectations has provided some relief to the beleaguered Japanese Yen. Second, verbal interventions from Japanese finance ministry officials have amplified market sensitivity around the 155.00 level. Technical charts reveal important support and resistance zones. The 155.00 handle acts as a major technical and psychological barrier. A sustained break below this level could trigger accelerated selling, potentially targeting the next support cluster near 153.50. Conversely, the 157.00 level now serves as immediate resistance. Market participants are analyzing trading volume and order flow data to gauge the conviction behind the current move. Key Support: 155.00 (Psychological & Technical) Key Resistance: 157.00 (Recent Swing High) 200-Day Moving Average: Currently near 152.80 Market Bias: Bearish below 155.50, Bullish above 157.50 The Paramount Influence of US Retail Sales Data Today’s primary market catalyst is the U.S. Retail Sales report. This data point serves as a direct gauge of American consumer health, which drives approximately 70% of the U.S. economy. The consensus forecast, according to a Bloomberg survey of economists, anticipates a month-over-month increase of 0.4% for the headline figure. Meanwhile, the Core Retail Sales figure, which excludes volatile automobile and gasoline sales, is expected to rise by 0.5%. The market’s reaction will hinge on the deviation from these expectations. A significantly stronger report could reignite fears of persistent inflationary pressures. This scenario might bolster the U.S. Dollar by reinforcing the narrative of a delayed Federal Reserve rate-cutting cycle. Conversely, a weak print would suggest a softening consumer, potentially accelerating the USD/JPY’s decline as rate cut expectations are brought forward. The data’s impact on U.S. Treasury yields, particularly the 10-year note, will be the immediate transmission mechanism to the currency pair. Data Point Forecast (MoM%) Previous (MoM%) Potential USD Impact Retail Sales Headline +0.4% +0.7% High Retail Sales ex-Autos/Gas +0.5% +1.1% Very High Control Group +0.4% +1.1% Critical for GDP Bank of Japan Intervention: The Ever-Present Wildcard Beyond U.S. data, the specter of Bank of Japan (BOJ) intervention looms large. Japanese authorities have consistently stated their readiness to act against excessive and disorderly currency moves. Historically, they have focused on the pace of depreciation rather than a specific level. However, the 155.00 area is widely viewed as a potential trigger zone for official checks or direct intervention. Finance Minister Shunichi Suzuki reiterated this stance recently, warning that the government would respond appropriately to excessive forex volatility. Market memory of the BOJ’s confirmed interventions in 2022, which occurred near the 152.00 level, informs current trader behavior. This creates a complex dynamic where algorithmic selling pressure meets potential official buying, increasing volatility risks around these key levels. Analysts scrutinize Japan’s Ministry of Finance currency reserve data and money market conditions for early signs of action. Broader Macroeconomic Drivers and Cross-Asset Correlations The USD/JPY trajectory does not exist in a vacuum. It reflects the stark monetary policy divergence between the Federal Reserve and the Bank of Japan. While the Fed has maintained a restrictive policy stance to combat inflation, the BOJ only recently exited its negative interest rate policy (NIRP) and yield curve control (YCC), embarking on a very gradual normalization path. This fundamental disparity has been the primary driver of the Yen’s multi-year weakness. Furthermore, the pair exhibits strong correlation with other market variables. It maintains a positive correlation with U.S. equity indices, particularly the S&P 500, as a weaker Yen benefits Japanese exporters and global risk sentiment. More importantly, it has an inverse correlation with the price of gold, which is often sought as a hedge against currency devaluation. Additionally, rising global energy prices, denominated in Dollars, exacerbate Japan’s trade deficit, applying further downward pressure on the Yen. Monetary Policy Divergence: Fed’s “higher for longer” vs. BOJ’s “gradual hikes.” Risk Sentiment Gauge: USD/JPY often rises with global equity markets. Commodity Link: Higher oil prices widen Japan’s trade deficit, weakening JPY. Safe-Haven Flows: Geopolitical stress can trigger Yen buying despite rate differentials. Conclusion The USD/JPY pair stands at a critical technical precipice near 155.00, with its immediate fate heavily dependent on the incoming U.S. Retail Sales data. This report will directly influence Federal Reserve policy expectations and, by extension, the U.S. Dollar’s momentum. However, traders must also remain acutely aware of the latent intervention risk from Japanese authorities, which can cause violent and unpredictable reversals. The interplay between fundamental U.S. data and Japan’s policy response defines the current high-stakes environment for the USD/JPY currency pair. Navigating this landscape requires attention to both economic indicators and official rhetoric from Tokyo and Washington. FAQs Q1: Why is the 155.00 level so important for USD/JPY? The 155.00 level is a major psychological and technical benchmark. It represents a round number that often concentrates trader interest and stop-loss orders. More critically, it is viewed by markets as a potential threshold that could prompt currency intervention from Japanese authorities to support the Yen. Q2: How does US Retail Sales data affect the Japanese Yen? Strong U.S. Retail Sales data suggests a robust American economy and persistent inflation, which can delay Federal Reserve interest rate cuts. This typically strengthens the U.S. Dollar against all currencies, including the Yen (pushing USD/JPY higher). Weak data has the opposite effect, potentially weakening the Dollar against the Yen. Q3: What is the Bank of Japan’s current policy stance? The Bank of Japan ended its negative interest rate policy in early 2024 but remains the most dovish major central bank. It is committed to a very gradual pace of policy normalization, maintaining accommodative financial conditions. This policy divergence with the Fed is a core reason for the Yen’s historical weakness. Q4: What other economic data should I watch alongside USD/JPY? Key data includes U.S. Consumer Price Index (CPI) for inflation, Non-Farm Payrolls for employment, and Federal Reserve meeting minutes. From Japan, watch Tokyo CPI inflation, the Tankan business survey, and any comments from the Finance Minister regarding currency levels. Q5: Can geopolitical events impact the USD/JPY exchange rate? Yes, absolutely. The Japanese Yen is traditionally considered a safe-haven currency. During periods of significant geopolitical tension or global market stress, investors may buy Yen despite unfavorable interest rate differentials, causing USD/JPY to fall unexpectedly. This post USD/JPY Plummets: Critical 155.00 Level in Sight as Traders Brace for US Retail Sales Data first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Analysts At Leading Wealth Manager Predict Bitcoin’s 2026 Price, And It’s Very Bullish
body: Bernstein analysts have reiterated that Bitcoin could still rally to $150,000 this year. These experts noted that BTC was experiencing what they described as the “worst bear case” in its history, suggesting that this bear market may not be as deep as previous cycles. Bernstein Predicts Bitcoin Rally To $150,000 By Year-End Bernstein analysts , led by Guatam Chhugani, have maintained that Bitcoin could still reach $150,000 by year-end despite its recent crash to as low as $60,000. The analysts stated that this is the weakest BTC bear case in its history. They added that what the market is currently experiencing is a “self-imposed crisis of confidence” rather than a failure in the system. Furthermore, the analysts explained that there hasn’t been any blow-up or other major catalyst that typically triggers Bitcoin bear markets. On the other hand, they believe the fundamentals are stronger than ever, citing the regulatory-friendly climate under President Donald Trump and growing institutional adoption through BTC ETFs and firms like Strategy. Bernstein analysts also addressed quantum threats to Bitcoin, noting that these threats affect not only the leading crypto but also the banking industry and other mission-critical systems. These analysts believe that this will be addressed when the time comes, with all these systems adopting quantum-resistant standards. Michael Saylor’s Strategy already plans to launch a Bitcoin security program to prepare for the threats posed by quantum computing. However, Saylor opined that the threat of quantum computing is still about ten years away, thereby urging investors not to panic. Meanwhile, Bernstein addressed concerns that large corporate holders, such as Strategy, could liquidate their holdings amid this market downturn. The firm stated that large corporate Bitcoin holders, such as Strategy, have structured their balance sheets to handle such market conditions. They alluded to Strategy CEO Phong Le’s statement that they won’t have to liquidate unless BTC drops to $8,000 and remains there for up to five years. BTC To Pick Up As Liquidity Conditions Ease Up Bernstein analysts have indicated that Bitcoin will rally again as liquidity conditions ease, noting that ETFs and corporations are well-positioned to accumulate more BTC as conditions improve. They also explained that the leading crypto continues to trade as a liquidity-sensitive risk asset rather than ‘digital gold,’ which is why it is underperforming gold , as liquidity remains concentrated in specific assets. It is worth noting that Bernstein analysts aren’t the only ones who have predicted that Bitcoin could still rally to a new all-time high (ATH) this year. TD Cowen analyst Lance Vitanza also stated last week that they expect BTC to reach a new ATH this year, with their base case being the third quarter of this year. At the time of writing, the Bitcoin price is trading at around $69,700, down almost 2% in the last 24 hours, according to data from CoinMarketCap.
tags: Bitcoin Mining|Bernstein|bitcoin|bitcoin news|bitcoin price|btc|BTC news|btc price|btcusd|BTCUSDT|Coinmarketcap|Donald Trump|ETFs|Guatam Chhugani|Lance Vitanza|michael saylor|Phong Le|Strategy|TD Cowen
